p: Dengue is notably the most important mosquito-borne viral disease, with approximately half the worldâ€™s population at risk of infection [ 1]. This arboviral disease, caused by a virus of the Flaviviridae family, has gained renewed global attention due to its wide geographical spread and increased burden in recent years. The spread of the disease is in concordance with the geographical expansion of its primary vector (i.e. Aedes aegypti), characterized by the presence of a suitable climate and increase in global trade and travel [ 2, 3].
